00051 // This structure mirrors the one found in /usr/include/asm/ucontext.h
00052 typedef struct _sig_ucontext
00053 {
00054   unsigned long     uc_flags;
00055   struct ucontext   *uc_link;
00056   stack_t           uc_stack;
00057   struct sigcontext uc_mcontext;
00058   sigset_t          uc_sigmask;
00059 } sig_ucontext_t;
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * Execute a system command and get output.
00063  */
00064 int exec_cmd_and_get_output(const char* cmd, std::string& result)
00065 {
00066   std::array<char, 128> buffer;
00067   std::unique_ptr<FILE, decltype(&pclose)> pipe(popen(cmd, "r"), pclose);
00068   if (!pipe)
00069     {
00070       return 0; //!< popen failed - unable to execute system command
00071     }
00072   while (fgets(buffer.data(), buffer.size(), pipe.get()) != nullptr)
00073     {
00074       result += buffer.data();
00075     }
00076   return 1;
00077 }
00078 
00079 /*
00080  * Custom error handler printing out in the journal the backtrace of the exception.
00081  */
00082 void crit_err_hdlr(True_int sig_num, siginfo_t * info, void * ucontext)
00083 {
00084   std::cerr << "Error handler triggered!! See Journal - process ID: " << Process::me() << std::endl;
00085   Process::Journal() << "signal " << (int)sig_num
00086                      << " (" << strsignal(sig_num) << "), address is "
00087                      << long(info->si_addr) << finl; //" from "
00088 
00089   void * array[100];
00090   int size = backtrace(array, 100);
00091 
00092   Process::Journal() << __FUNCTION__ << " backtrace returned " << size << " frames\n" << finl;
00093 
00094 // Extract symbols from backtrace
00095   char ** messages = backtrace_symbols(array, size);
00096 
00097 // Skip first stack frame (points here) and print out backtrace
00098   for (int i = 1; i < size && messages != NULL; ++i)
00099     {
00100       Process::Journal() << "[proc " << Process::me() << "]: (" << i << ") " << messages[i] << finl;
00101 // Find first occurence of '(' or ' ' in message[i] and assume
00102 // everything before that is the file name (don't go beyond 0 though, string terminator)
00103       size_t p = 0;
00104       while(messages[i][p] != '(' && messages[i][p] != ' '
00105             && messages[i][p] != 0)
00106         ++p;
00107 
00108 // Call 'addr2line' system utility to extract line number in the source code:
00109       char syscom[256];
00110       sprintf(syscom, "addr2line %p --functions -e %.*s | tr '\n' ' ' | c++filt", array[i], (True_int)p, messages[i]);
00111       std::string output;
00112       int ret = exec_cmd_and_get_output(syscom, output);
00113       if(!ret)
00114         Process::Journal() << "(Unable to execute 'addr2line' to get line number in source ...)" << finl;
00115       else
00116         Process::Journal() << "[proc " << Process::me() << "]: (" << i << ") ----> "
00117                            << output.c_str() << finl;
00118     }
00119   Process::Journal() << finl;
00120   free(messages);
00121 
00122   Process::exit();
00123 }
00124 
00125 /*
00126  * Install error handlers catching SIGABRT and SIGFPE
00127  */
00128 void install_handlers()
00129 {
00130   struct sigaction sigact;
00131   sigemptyset(&sigact.sa_mask);
00132   sigact.sa_sigaction = crit_err_hdlr;
00133   sigact.sa_flags = SA_RESTART | SA_SIGINFO;
00134 
00135   if (sigaction(SIGABRT, &sigact, (struct sigaction *)NULL) != 0)
00136     {
00137       std::cerr << "FATAL ERROR setting handler for signal " << SIGABRT
00138                 << " (" << strsignal(SIGABRT) << ")" << std::endl;
00139       Process::exit();
00140     }
00141 
00142   if (sigaction(SIGFPE, &sigact, (struct sigaction *)NULL) != 0)
00143     {
00144       std::cerr << "FATAL ERROR setting handler for signal " << SIGFPE
00145                 << " (" << strsignal(SIGFPE) << ")" << std::endl;
00146       Process::exit();
00147     }
00148   std::cerr << "Custom error handlers correctly installed. SIGFPE and SIGABRT redirected." << std::endl;
00149 }
